intro: Centaurea albinervis, commonly known as the white-veined centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in a composite head, which is typical of the daisy family. Centaurea albinervis is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, often growing in dry, open habitats. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soils.
